Request WRITE_SETTINGS PERMISSION
Settings Brightness
The slider and numeric field below reflect, and enable you to set if the app has WRITE_SETTINGS PERMISSION, the screen brightness in the Settings page.
You need to request WRITE_SETTINGS PERMISSION to change this.
Press this button to Request WRITE_SETTINGS PERMISSION
Already Checked
Auto
Manual
This button is checked if the global screen brightness reported by Settings.System.getInt(…,\"screen_brightness_mode\" is AUTO. You need to request WRITE_SETTINGS PERMISSION to change it.
Press this button to set the global screen brightness reported by Settings.System.getInt(…,\"screen_brightness_mode\" to AUTO.
This button is checked if the global screen brightness reported by Settings.System.getInt(…,\"screen_brightness_mode\" is MANUAL. You need to request WRITE_SETTINGS PERMISSION to change it.
Press this button to set the global screen brightness reported by Settings.System.getInt(…,\"screen_brightness_mode\". to AUTO.
This slider bar shows the global screen brightness reported by Settings.System.getInt(…,\"screen_brightness\". You need to request WRITE_SETTINGS PERMISSION to change it.
This slider bar shows the global screen brightness reported by Settings.System.getInt(…,\"screen_brightness\". You can adjust it by dragging the slider or clicking on a new value.
This number shows the global screen brightness reported by Settings.System.getInt(…,\"screen_brightness\". You need to request WRITE_SETTINGS PERMISSION to change it.
This number shows the global screen brightness reported by Settings.System.getInt(…,\"screen_brightness\". You can adjust it by overtyping with a new value.
Window Brightness
The slider and numeric field below reflect and enable you to override the screen brightness from the Settings page with a local value which is used only for this page.
Settings
Override

Press this button to set the screen brightness for this app\'s window as reported by getWindow().getAttributes().screenBrightness to -1, which means that the screen brightness from the global settings is used for this page.

Press this button to set the screen brightness for this page as controlled by getWindow().getAttributes().screenBrightness to the screen brightness from the global settings: the slider will appear enabling you to adjust the brightness to some other value.

This slider bar shows the value of getWindow().getAttributes().screenBrightness rescaled to 0..255, if it is positive. If the value is negative, the slider is not shown. You can adjust it by dragging the slider or clicking on a new value.

This number shows the value of getWindow().getAttributes().screenBrightness rescaled to 0..255, if it is positive. If the value is negative, the number is not shown. You can adjust it by overtyping with a new value.
Opacity

The slider and numeric field below enable you to set he opacity of the text in this window. Setting opacity provides an alternative way for an app to set the effective screen brightness in dark mode. Note however that this will not save power on a backlit screen.
This slider bar shows the opacity of the text in this window. You can adjust it by dragging the slider or clicking on a new value.
This number shows the opacity of the text in this window. You can adjust it by overtyping with a new value.
"Lux: "
This shows the ambient light value in lux as measured by the device\'s sensor.
